properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 5 at 1:17PM MST until January 6 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW POSSIBLE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY
EVENING...

* WHAT...Snow expected. Higher elevation total snow accumulations
of 6 to 9 inches, localized totals near a foot possible. Winds
gusting as high as 65 mph.

* WHERE...Higher elevations of the Snowy Range.

* WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 6 PM MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. Trails and paths could be
covered by heavy snow. Avoid outdoor recreation in the back
country without the proper gear. Gusty winds could bring down
tree branches.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 PM MST MONDAY
